author: Herald Staff
title: Watertown ties record
text:
Watertown field hockey’s 5-0 Middlesex League win at Wilmington yesterday marked the program’s 153rd straight game without a loss, tying the national record. The Red Raiders can set a new mark tomorrow when they host Melrose .
Lexie Davidson had three goals and two assists as North Andover (10-3-1) shut out Lawrence in Merrimack Valley Conference play.
Boys soccer
Henry Rohner had a four-goal, one-assist afternoon as Manchester Essex (7-4-3) came from behind to defeat Cape Ann rival Ipswich , 5-2.
Jerry Ozor’s lone goal was all Milton Academy (11-0) needed to beat Phillips Andover , 1-0, in Independent School League action.
Nathan Perez scored twice to lead Lowell Catholic (9-4-1) to a 5-0 shutout of St. Joseph’s Prep in Catholic Central play.
Girls soccer
Carolina Ivanov’s hat trick paced Ipswich (3-8-3) to a 4-2 win over Manchester Essex in the Cape Ann League.
Grace Oliver scored twice to lead Rockland (8-5-3) to a 5-0 win over Abington in South Shore League action.
Volleyball
Jose Rowean notched 16 kills as King Philip (12-4) topped North Attleboro , 3-0, in the Hockomock League.
Lauren Manis recorded eight kills, five aces and six blocks as Bishop Feehan (8-4) beat Bishop Stang , 3-1, in the Eastern Athletic Conference.
Jenny Norcross had 12 kills as Marblehead (12-0) remained undefeated with a 3-0 win over North Reading in non-league play.
Golf
St. John’s Prep ’s Chris Francoeur shot a 1-under par 69 to clinch the individual title at the Division 1 North sectional at the Beverly Golf & Tennis Club. The Eagles shot a record 290 to win the team title.
Compiled by Kat Hasenauer Cornetta and Matt Feld.
